section.title: Configuring Referrals by Using the OpenAM Console
section.para: This section describes the process of creating referrals within an application by using the OpenAM Console.
By default, referrals are not displayed in the policy editor within the OpenAM console.

procedure.title: To Enable Referrals in the Policy Editor

step.para: In the OpenAM console, select Configuration > Global > Policy Configuration, set Activate Referrals to Enabled, and then click Save.

section.para: Referrals enable applications and policies to exist in different realms, and redirect incoming authorization requests to those realms.

procedure.title: To Configure Referrals by Using the Policy Editor

step.para: In the OpenAM console, select Access Control > Realm Name > Policies, and then click the name of the application to create a referral in.
To create a new referral, click Add New Referral.
To modify an existing referral, click the name of the referral.
To discard any changes and return to the previous page, click Cancel.
Provide a name for the referral, and then click Next.
To define resources that the referral applies to, follow the steps below:
In the Available patterns section, click the row containing the pattern to use as the template for a resource pattern to move it to the Create your resources section.

mediaobject.alt: Modify the resource patterns to specify the resources the policy applies to.

step.para: Optionally, in the Create your resources section, replace the asterisks with values to define the resources that the referral applies to.

mediaobject.alt: Edit the resource pattern if required.

step.para:
For information on specifying patterns for matching resources, see
Specifying Resource Patterns with Wildcards .
Click the Add icon to move the resource into the Resources section.

mediaobject.alt: Add the completed resource to the Resources section by clicking the Add icon.

textobject.para: Add the resource to the Resources section.

tip.para: To remove a resource, click the Delete icon.

step.para: Repeat these steps to add all the resources your referral applies to, and then click Next.
In the Available realms drop-down, select a realm to which the referral redirects requests, and then click the Add icon. You can add multiple target realms.

note.para: A referral can only redirect requests to a child, or sibling of the realm it is created in. The Available realms drop-down only displays valid realms.

step.para: To remove an entry, click the Delete icon in the row containing the realm to remove.

tip.para: If the configuration is not visible, click the maximized link to switch to maximized view.

step.para: To make changes to the configuration, either click the relevant step, or click the item to jump to the relevant step and make amendments to the configuration.
When the configuration is completed, click Finish.
